p.k: Conventional optical microscopes have limits as to how small a thing and how wide a target area they can show. This episode looks at clever ideas and tech for exceeding those limits.
p.d: For more than 400 years, people have used microscopes to show more about the inner workings of plants and animals than can be seen with the naked eye. Microscope technology has greatly improved since, but has also encountered the limits of how small a thing and how wide a target area it can show. In this episode, we'll see clever ideas and technologies that get around these barriers.
